Plot bootstrap output for BEAM sets

Source: R/plot_beam_boot.R
plot_beam_boot.Rd

#' plot_beam_boot produces a pairs plot of the beam stats matrices. Default is maximum of 5 plots, ordered by most significant association direction.

Usage

plot_beam_boot(
  beam.result,
  beam.feat.pvals,
  beam.specs = NULL,
  set.id,
  max.plots = 4,
  z = TRUE
)

Arguments

beam.result

A beam.stats object from compute_beam_stats

beam.feat.pvals

A list containing feature-level p-values from compute_feature_pvalues.

beam.specs

A data.frame. Default NULL, in which case beam.result$beam.specs is used. Otherwise can input other beam.specs data.frame that must contain name, mtx, mdl, plot columns.

set.id

A character specifying the name of a set. Must be in beam.result$beam.data$set.data

max.plots

A number specifying the max number of rows in the pairs plot. Default is 4, ordered by feature-level p-value.

z

Logical indicating whether to z-scale each vector of one coefficient estimate across bootstraps before plotting. Default is TRUE.

Value

A pairs plot figure.

Examples

# \donttest{
test.beam.data <- prep_beam_data(main.data=clinf, mtx.data=omicdat,
                                 mtx.anns=omicann, set.data=setdat,
                                 set.anns=NULL, n.boot=10, seed=123)
#> Checking inputs: Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#>   Checking that each element of mtx.data is a matrix: Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#>   Checking that each element of mtx.anns is a data.frame: Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#> Aligning main.data with each mtx.data: Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#>   Working on mtx.data Lesion (1 of 2): Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#>   Working on mtx.data RNA (2 of 2): Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#> Warning: Some ids not matched; returning NAs for those.
#>   Working on mtx.anns: Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#>   Matching matrix 1 with annotations: Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#>   Matching matrix 2 with annotations: Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#>   Checking set.data: Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#>     Ordering and indexing set.data: Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#>     Checking section 1 of 40 of set.data: Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#> Generating bootstrap index matrix: Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#> Packaging and returning result: Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
specs <- prep_beam_specs(beam.data=test.beam.data, endpts=c("MRD29", "EFS"),
                         firth=TRUE)
#> MRD29 is continuous, fitting lm
#> EFS is survival endpoint, fitting coxphf2
test.beam.stats <- compute_beam_stats(beam.data=test.beam.data,
                                      beam.specs=specs)
#> Working on analysis 1 of 4 : Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#> Lesionlm(MRD29~mtx.row,data=main.data,model=T)
#>   Working on bootstrap 0 of 11 : Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#>   Working on bootstrap 10 of 11 : Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#> Working on analysis 2 of 4 : Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#> RNAlm(MRD29~mtx.row,data=main.data,model=T)
#>   Working on bootstrap 0 of 11 : Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#>   Working on bootstrap 10 of 11 : Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#> Working on analysis 3 of 4 : Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#> Lesioncoxphf2(EFS~mtx.row,data=main.data,model=T)
#>   Working on bootstrap 0 of 11 : Fri Jul 12 18:38:55 2024
#>   Working on bootstrap 10 of 11 : Fri Jul 12 18:39:10 2024
#> Working on analysis 4 of 4 : Fri Jul 12 18:39:12 2024
#> RNAcoxphf2(EFS~mtx.row,data=main.data,model=T)
#>   Working on bootstrap 0 of 11 : Fri Jul 12 18:39:12 2024
#>   Working on bootstrap 10 of 11 : Fri Jul 12 18:39:29 2024
test.pvals <- compute_set_pvalues(beam.stats=test.beam.stats)
#> Preparing bootstrap results for calculating feature set p-values: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#> Finding stats for each data matrix:Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>   Finding stats for data matrix Lesion: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>    Finding features with with Lesion.MRD29 stats: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>    Finding features with with Lesion.EFS stats: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>   Finding stats for data matrix RNA: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>    Finding features with with RNA.MRD29 stats: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>    Finding features with with RNA.EFS stats: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#> Found 80 rows of stats: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#> Merging stats with feature-sets: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#> Merged feature-set stat rows: 80
#> Ordering and indexing feature sets: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>   Cleaning up beam.stat matrices:Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>    Working on matrix 1 of 4: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>    Working on matrix 2 of 4: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>    Working on matrix 3 of 4: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>    Working on matrix 4 of 4: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#> Computing p-value for feature set 1 of 34: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#> 12ENSG00000081760
#> Computing p-value for feature set 26 of 34: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#> 6364ENSG00000229835
#> Finished computing p-values at: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#> Minimum q-value is 0.165505833699241
#> Creating set p-value data frame.
#> Done creating data frame.
#> Creating list for output.
test.feat.pvals <- compute_feature_pvalues(beam.stats=test.beam.stats)
#> Computing feature p-values for stat matrix 1 of 4: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>   This matrix has 20 features.
#> Computing feature p-values for stat matrix 2 of 4: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>   This matrix has 20 features.
#> Computing feature p-values for stat matrix 3 of 4: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>   This matrix has 20 features.
#> Computing feature p-values for stat matrix 4 of 4: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>   This matrix has 20 features.
test.boot.plot <- plot_beam_boot(test.beam.stats, test.feat.pvals,
                                 set.id="ENSG00000099810")

# }
data(beam_stats)
test.pvals <- compute_set_pvalues(beam.stats=beam_stats)
#> Preparing bootstrap results for calculating feature set p-values: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#> Finding stats for each data matrix:Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024

#>    Finding features with with RNA.MRD29 stats: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>    Finding features with with RNA.EFS stats: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#>    Finding features with with RNA.OS stats: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024
#> Found 120 rows of stats: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024

#> Computing feature p-values for stat matrix 6 of 6: Fri Jul 12 18:39:31 2024

test.boot.plot <- plot_beam_boot(beam_stats, test.feat.pvals,
                                 set.id="ENSG00000099810")
